verses.verse: (A Prayer of Moses the man of God.) Lord, <S%H136><s%> Thou hast been <S%H1961><s%> our dwelling <S%H4583><s%> place <S%H4583><s%> in all <S%H1755><s%> generations. <S%H1755><s%>

Before <S%H2962><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> were born, <S%H3205><s%> Or Thou didst give <S%H9123><s%> birth <S%H9123><s%> to the earth <S%H776><s%> and the world, <S%H8398><s%> Even from everlasting <S%H5769><s%> to everlasting, <S%H5769><s%> Thou art God. <S%H410><s%>
Thou dost turn <S%H7725><s%> man <S%H582><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> into dust, <S%H9085><s%> And dost say, <S%H559><s%> "Return, <S%H7725><s%> O children <S%H1121><s%> of men. <S%H120><s%>"

For a thousand <S%H505><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in Thy sight <S%H5869><s%> Are like yesterday <S%H3117><s%> <S%H8543><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> it passes <S%H5674><s%> by, Or [as] a watch <S%H821><s%> in the night. <S%H3915><s%>

Thou hast swept <S%H2229><s%> them away <S%H2229><s%> like <S%H2229><s%> a flood, <S%H2229><s%> they fall <S%H1961><s%> asleep; <S%H8142><s%> In the morning <S%H1242><s%> they are like grass <S%H2682><s%> which sprouts <S%H2498><s%> anew. <S%H2498><s%>
In the morning <S%H1242><s%> it flourishes, <S%H6692><s%> and sprouts <S%H2498><s%> anew; <S%H2498><s%> Toward evening <S%H6153><s%> it fades, <S%H9268><s%> and withers <S%H3001><s%> away.
For we have been <S%H3615><s%> consumed <S%H3615><s%> by Thine anger, <S%H639><s%> And by Thy wrath <S%H2534><s%> we have been dismayed. <S%H926><s%>
Thou hast placed <S%H7896><s%> our iniquities <S%H5771><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> Thee, Our secret <S%H5956><s%> [sins] in the light <S%H3974><s%> of Thy presence. <S%H6440><s%>
For all <S%H3605><s%> our days <S%H3117><s%> have declined <S%H6437><s%> in Thy fury; <S%H5678><s%> We have finished <S%H3615><s%> our years <S%H8141><s%> like <S%H3644><s%> a sigh. <S%H1899><s%>

As for the days <S%H3117><s%> of our life, <S%H8141><s%> they contain seventy <S%H7657><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> Or if <S%H518><s%> due to strength, <S%H1369><s%> eighty <S%H8084><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> Yet their pride <S%H7296><s%> is [but] labor <S%H5999><s%> and sorrow; <S%H205><s%> For soon <S%H2440><s%> it is gone <S%H1468><s%> and we fly <S%H5774><s%> away. <S%H5774><s%>
Who <S%H4310><s%> understands <S%H3045><s%> the power <S%H5797><s%> of Thine anger, <S%H639><s%> And Thy fury, <S%H5678><s%> according to the fear <S%H3374><s%> that is due Thee?
So <S%H3651><s%> teach <S%H3045><s%> us to number <S%H4487><s%> our days, <S%H3117><s%> That we may present <S%H935><s%> to Thee a heart <S%H3824><s%> of wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>
Do return, <S%H7725><s%> O Lord; <S%H3068><s%> how <S%H4970><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H4970><s%> [will it be]? And be sorry <S%H5162><s%> for Thy servants. <S%H5650><s%>

O satisfy <S%H7646><s%> us in the morning <S%H1242><s%> with Thy lovingkindness, <S%H2617><s%> That we may sing <S%H7442><s%> for joy <S%H7442><s%> and be glad <S%H8055><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> our days. <S%H3117><s%>
Make <S%H8055><s%> us glad <S%H8055><s%> according to the days <S%H3117><s%> Thou hast afflicted <S%H6031><s%> us, [And] the years <S%H8141><s%> we have seen <S%H7200><s%> evil. <S%H9567><s%>
Let Thy work <S%H6467><s%> appear <S%H7200><s%> to Thy servants, <S%H5650><s%> And Thy majesty <S%H1926><s%> to their children. <S%H1121><s%>

And let the favor <S%H5278><s%> of the Lord <S%H136><s%> our God <S%H430><s%> be upon us; And do confirm <S%H3559><s%> for us the work <S%H4639><s%> of our hands; <S%H3027><s%> Yes, confirm <S%H3559><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of our hands. <S%H3027><s%>
